snippet: Unemployment rates in many countries are expected to be higher next year than they were last year, according to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column notes that while unemployment is not improving, index of total working hours is on the rise, meaning those who are employed have more money to spend; holds that such spending could eventually lead to an uptick in hiring.
lead_paragraph: Unemployment rates in many countries are expected to be higher next year than they were last year, according to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.

headline.print_headline: As Bad as It May Be Here, It’s Worse in Europe
headline.seo: As Bad as It May Be Here, It’s Worse in Europe
headline.main: As Bad as It May Be in the U.S., It’s Worse in Europe
